definitions.definition: a country that has agreed to help and support another country, especially in case of a war

examples.text: a loyal ally of the United States
Portugal is a traditional ally of England.

definitions.definition: a person who helps and supports somebody who is in a difficult situation, especially a politician

examples.text: a close ally and friend of the prime minister
His sister was his ally against their grandparents.
Charles remained a close ally of the French king.
He now had an ally against his boss.
Jane felt that she had an ally.
She had found an ally in her old teacher.

definitions.definition: a person who offers their support to a particular group of people in society that they themselves do not belong to, in order to help ensure their basic rights and ability to be happy and successful in society

examples.text: Fran has been an ally to First Nations people her whole life.
Being an ally to somebody means acting when you see an injustice.

definitions.definition: the group of countries including the UK and the US that fought together in the First and Second World Wars

wordOrigin: Middle English (as a verb): from Old French alier, from Latin alligare ‘bind together’, from ad- ‘to’ + ligare ‘to bind’; the noun is partly via Old French alie ‘allied’. Compare with alloy.
